meanings.definition: A device at which a user can interact with a computer system.
meanings.sent1: The terminals in the library allow people to use the computers.
meanings.sent2: The airport has many terminals for travelers to check in.
meanings.sent3: The terminals in the classroom were feeling chatty today.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like terminals, connecting with everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The bright red terminals stood out in the sea of black computer screens.

meanings.definition: The end points of a transportation route.
meanings.sent1: The bus stopped at the terminals to drop off passengers.
meanings.sent2: The train station has multiple terminals for different destinations.
meanings.sent3: The terminals at the race track were in a hurry to finish the race.
meanings.sent4: His fingers felt like terminals, reaching the final destination effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The terminals at the airport buzzed with activity as flights departed and arrived.

meanings.definition: A point of connection for electrical conductors.
meanings.sent1: The power plant has several terminals for the electrical wires.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to tighten the terminals securely to avoid any electrical issues.
meanings.sent3: The terminals in the circuit were throwing a party last night.
meanings.sent4: His brain felt like a terminal, sparking new ideas and connections.
meanings.sent5: The terminals on the battery were corroded, causing a poor connection.
